dialog_1.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_1.text: Well, blast. You've actually done it—broken my curse and ruined my perfectly good entertainment.

dialog_2.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_2.text: Quite impressive, really, especially with that useless gun of yours.

dialog_3.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_3.text: Off you go then, pot-smasher. Try not to get locked in any more dungeons.

dialog_4.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_4.text: The next warden might lack my delightful personality.

dialog_5.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_5.text: Farewell, and do avoid any suspicious-looking doors in the future.

dialog_9.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_9.text: You're... still here. Still clicking. I can sense it.

dialog_10.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_10.text: The door is open, you know. That red one. Remember? The whole point of this exercise?

dialog_11.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_11.text: I suppose you're waiting for credits or something. This is a game jam, dear adventurer—

dialog_12.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_12.text: we barely had time to program a working jump button, let alone credits.

dialog_13.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_13.text: Are you perhaps expecting a sequel hook? 'The Dungeon Master will return in... Pottery Revenge?' Please.

dialog_14.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_14.text: Or maybe you think there's a secret ending? There isn't. This is it. You won. Congratulations.

dialog_15.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_15.text: Your prize is freedom and the lingering scent of spontaneously combusted skeletons.

dialog_16.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_16.text: You know, I had hobbies before this whole 'eternal dungeon warden' business. I collected stamps.

dialog_17.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_17.text: Seventeen different varieties of commemorative moth stamps, if you must know.

dialog_18.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_18.text: Still clicking, I see. Fascinating. Do you think if you click enough times I'll reveal the meaning of life?

dialog_19.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_19.text: It's 42. There, saved you some time.

dialog_20.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_20.text: I'm starting to think you enjoy my company. How... unexpectedly touching. And mildly concerning.

dialog_21.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_21.text: Should I be flattered? Worried? I honestly haven't had a visitor stay this long since...

dialog_22.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_22.text: well, since that unfortunate incident with the over-enthusiastic bard who wouldn't stop asking for 'just one more song.'

dialog_23.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_23.text: You do realize there's a whole world out there? Sunshine, fresh air, people who aren't trapped in dungeons

dialog_25.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_25.text: No? Still here? Alright then. Did I ever tell you about my brief career as a travel agent for cursed locations?

dialog_26.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_26.text: 'Visit Sunny Skeleton Shore! See the Haunted Hammocks of Horror!'

dialog_27.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_27.text: This is getting rather awkward, isn't it? Like when someone says goodbye but then you both start

dialog_29.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_29.text: Perhaps you're conducting some sort of social experiment. 'How long will a disembodied dungeon master

dialog_30.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_30.text: continue talking to an unresponsive adventurer?' The answer, apparently, is 'disturbingly long.'

dialog_31.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_31.text: I could tell you about my collection of philosophical complaints about dungeon architecture,

dialog_32.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_32.text: but I suspect even you have limits.

dialog_33.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_33.text: Fine. FINE. You win this staring contest too. I'll just... be here. Doing dungeon master things.

dialog_35.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_35.text: Any time you're ready to leave, the door is RIGHT THERE.

dialog_36.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_36.text: Still here? Really? Well, this is new.

dialog_37.name: The Insufferably Charming Imprisoner
dialog_37.text: Thanks For Playing!!! Bye Bye Now.
